members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
SQL Server implementation of the abstract DataProvider class
This concreted data provider class provides the implementation of the abstract methods from data dataprovider.cs
In most cases you will only modify the Public methods region below.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
An abstract class for the data access layer
The abstract data provider provides the methods that a control data provider (sqldataprovider) must implement. You'll find two commented out examples in the Abstract methods region below.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:Satrabel.HttpModules.UrlRewriterLogging.getQSParams(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: getQSParams builds up a new querystring. This is necessary in order to prep for navigateUrl. we don't ever want a tabid, a ctl and a language parameter in the qs also, the portalid param is not allowed when the tab is a supertab (because NavigateUrl adds the portalId param to the qs)

member.name: M:Satrabel.HttpModules.UrlRewriterLogging.newUrl(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: newUrl returns the new URL based on the new language. Basically it is just a call to NavigateUrl, with stripped qs parameters

member.name: T:DotNetNuke.Modules.OpenUrlRewriter.OpenUrlRewriterModuleBase
member.summary:
This base class can be used to define custom properties for multiple controls. An example module, DNNSimpleArticle (http://dnnsimplearticle.codeplex.com) uses this for an ArticleId
Because the class inherits from PortalModuleBase, properties like ModuleId, TabId, UserId, and others, are accessible to your module's controls (that inherity from OpenUrlRewriterModuleBase

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The EditOpenUrlRewriter class is used to manage content
Typically your edit control would be used to create new content, or edit existing content within your module. The ControlKey for this control is "Edit", and is defined in the manifest (.dnn) file.
Because the control inherits from OpenUrlRewriterModuleBase you have access to any custom properties defined there, as well as properties from DNN such as PortalId, ModuleId, TabId, UserId and many more.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Settings class manages Module Settings
Typically your settings control would be used to manage settings for your module. There are two types of settings, ModuleSettings, and TabModuleSettings.
ModuleSettings apply to all "copies" of a module on a site, no matter which page the module is on.
TabModuleSettings apply only to the current module on the current page, if you copy that module to another page the settings are not transferred.
If you happen to save both TabModuleSettings and ModuleSettings, TabModuleSettings overrides ModuleSettings.
Below we have some examples of how to access these settings but you will need to uncomment to use.
Because the control inherits from OpenUrlRewriterSettingsBase you have access to any custom properties defined there, as well as properties from DNN such as PortalId, ModuleId, TabId, UserId and many more.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Settings class.
Auto-generated class.

This base class can be used to define custom properties for multiple controls. An example module, DNNSimpleArticle (http://dnnsimplearticle.codeplex.com) uses this for an ArticleId
Because the class inherits from SettingsModuleBase, properties like ModuleId, TabId, UserId, and others, are accessible to your module's controls (that inherity from OpenUrlRewriterSettingsBase

EditOpenUrlRewriter class.
Auto-generated class.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The EditOpenUrlRewriter class is used to manage content
Typically your edit control would be used to create new content, or edit existing content within your module. The ControlKey for this control is "Edit", and is defined in the manifest (.dnn) file.
Because the control inherits from OpenUrlRewriterModuleBase you have access to any custom properties defined there, as well as properties from DNN such as PortalId, ModuleId, TabId, UserId and many more.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The Controller class for OpenUrlRewriter
The FeatureController class is defined as the BusinessController in the manifest file (.dnn) DotNetNuke will poll this class to find out which Interfaces the class implements.
The IPortable interface is used to import/export content from a DNN module
The ISearchable interface is used by DNN to index the content of a module
The IUpgradeable interface allows module developers to execute code during the upgrade process for a module.
Below you will find stubbed out implementations of each, uncomment and populate with your own data
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:Satrabel.SitemapProviders.OpenUrlRewriterSitemapProvider.GetUrls(System.Int32,DotNetNuke.Entities.Portals.PortalSettings,System.String)
member.summary: Includes page urls on the sitemap
member.remarks: Pages that are included: - are not deleted - are not disabled - are normal pages (not links,...) - are visible (based on date and permissions)

member.name: M:Satrabel.SitemapProviders.OpenUrlRewriterSitemapProvider.GetPageUrl(DotNetNuke.Entities.Tabs.TabInfo,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Return the sitemap url node for the page
member.param: Culture code to use in the URL
member.returns: A SitemapUrl object for the current page

member.name: M:Satrabel.SitemapProviders.OpenUrlRewriterSitemapProvider.GetPriority(DotNetNuke.Entities.Tabs.TabInfo)
member.summary: When page level priority is used, the priority for each page will be computed from the hierarchy level of the page. Top level pages will have a value of 1, second level 0.9, third level 0.8, ...
member.returns: The priority assigned to the page

member.name: F:ResponseFilterStream._position
member.summary: Current position in the original stream

member.name: F:ResponseFilterStream._cacheStream
member.summary: Stream that original content is read into and then passed to TransformStream function

member.name: F:ResponseFilterStream._cachePointer
member.summary: Internal pointer that that keeps track of the size of the cacheStream

member.name: M:ResponseFilterStream.OnTransformCompleteString(System.String)
member.summary:
Allows transforming of strings
Note this handler is internal and not meant to be overridden as the TransformString Event has to be hooked up in order for this handler to even fire to avoid the overhead of string conversion on every pass through.

member.name: M:ResponseFilterStream.OnTransformCompleteStringInternal(System.IO.MemoryStream)
member.summary: Wrapper method form OnTransformString that handles stream to string and vice versa conversions

member.name: M:ResponseFilterStream.Flush
member.summary: Override flush by writing out the cached stream data

member.name: M:ResponseFilterStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Overriden to capture output written by ASP.NET and captured into a cached stream that is written out later when Flush() is called.

member.name: P:ResponseFilterStream.IsCaptured
member.summary: Determines whether the stream is captured

member.name: P:ResponseFilterStream.IsOutputDelayed
member.summary: Determines whether the Write method is outputting data immediately or delaying output until Flush() is fired.

member.name: E:ResponseFilterStream.CaptureStream
member.summary: Event that captures Response output and makes it available as a MemoryStream instance. Output is captured but won't affect Response output.

member.name: E:ResponseFilterStream.CaptureString
member.summary: Event that captures Response output and makes it available as a string. Output is captured but won't affect Response output.

member.name: E:ResponseFilterStream.TransformWrite
member.summary:
Event that allows you transform the stream as each chunk of the output is written in the Write() operation of the stream. This means that that it's possible/likely that the input buffer will not contain the full response output but only one of potentially many chunks.
This event is called as part of the filter stream's Write() operation.

member.name: E:ResponseFilterStream.TransformWriteString
member.summary:
Event that allows you to transform the response stream as each chunk of bytep[] output is written during the stream's write operation. This means it's possibly/likely that the string passed to the handler only contains a portion of the full output. Typical buffer chunks are around 16k a piece.
This event is called as part of the stream's Write operation.

member.name: E:ResponseFilterStream.TransformStream
member.summary: This event allows capturing and transformation of the entire output stream by caching all write operations and delaying final response output until Flush() is called on the stream.

member.name: E:ResponseFilterStream.TransformString
member.summary: Event that can be hooked up to handle Response.Filter Transformation. Passed a string that you can modify and return back as a return value. The modified content will become the final output.

member.name: M:Satrabel.Services.Sitemap.OpenSitemapBuilder.#ctor(DotNetNuke.Entities.Portals.PortalSettings)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the sitemap builder class
member.param: Current PortalSettings for the portal being processed

member.name: M:Satrabel.Services.Sitemap.OpenSitemapBuilder.GetSitemapIndexFile(System.String,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Returns the sitemap file that is part of a sitemapindex.
member.param: Index of the sitemap to return
member.remarks: The file should already exist since when using sitemapindexes the files are all cached to disk

member.name: M:Satrabel.Services.Sitemap.OpenSitemapBuilder.WriteSitemap(System.Boolean,System.IO.TextWriter,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{DotNetNuke.Services.Sitemap.SitemapUrl})
member.param: Wheter the generated file should be cached or not
For sitemapindex files the number of the file being generated, 0 otherwise
The list of urls to be included in the file
member.remarks: If the output should be cached it will generate a file under the portal directory (portals\[portalid]\sitemaps\) with the result of the generation. If the file is part of a sitemap, index will be appended to the filename cached on disk ("sitemap_1.xml")

member.name: M:Satrabel.Services.Sitemap.OpenSitemapBuilder.WriteSitemapIndex(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Int32)
member.param: Number of files that are included in the sitemap index

member.name: M:Satrabel.Services.Sitemap.OpenSitemapBuilder.AddURL(DotNetNuke.Services.Sitemap.SitemapUrl)
member.summary: Adds a new url to the sitemap
member.param: The url to be included in the sitemap

member.name: M:Satrabel.Services.Sitemap.OpenSitemapBuilder.CacheIsValid
member.summary: Is sitemap is cached, verifies is the cached file exists and is still valid
member.returns: True is the cached file exists and is still valid, false otherwise

member.name: M:Satrabel.Services.Sitemap.OpenSitemapBuilder.WriteSitemapFileToOutput(System.String,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: When the sitemap is cached, reads the sitemap file and writes to the output stream
